text: In my heritage, Chinese New Year is the
most important celebration of the year.
And with any celebration, symbols are
what make the tradition.
The fish, in Mandarin, is 'yu,'
and its of a similar sound to the 'yu'
that means surplus or abundance.

The fish is steamed in whole from
head to tail during the new year.

A common mixture of 
scallion, ginger, soy sauce

that adds to the flavors & 
colors on the plate.

Leading up to the new year,
families would gather to make
chicken or pork dumplings by hand.
They're a symbol of wealth.

because they closely 
resemble traditional Chinese gold.

It is said that dumplings
should never be

arranged in circles 
but always in lines.

Circles could represent 
that a person's life
will lead nowhere.
The sticky rice cake, 'nian gao,'
with 'nian,' which means 'sticky'

closely sounding like the 'nian,'
which means 'year.'
And 'gao,' which means 'cake'

sounding like 'gao,'
which means 'high.'

This cake symbolizes an increased
prosperity for the year.

Made with brown sugar, 
glutinous rice flour and coconut milk.

This cake is commonly topped
with a Chinese red date
and steamed until firm.

There are many symbolic dishes,
bites, snacks
that bring together the new year.

They serve as ways to wish
well to loved ones and others

And they serve a reminder of the
wonderful happy new year.
